lz_desc: Air Evac parking pad for Air Evac 45 helicopter

comments: Pad is a parking pad for Air Evac 45 Helicopter at M95 Airfield.  General Aviation parking ramp is approximately 100 feet northeast of Air Evac 45's parking pad.  The general aviation ramp has self-serve Jet-A and Avgas.  The airfield has several GPS Instrument Approaches.  The Fayette Medical Center Helipad is approximately a 1/2 mile southwest of Air Evac's pad.

lz_desc: The helipad is located on Nucor Steel Hickman property.  Call the security office (870) 838-2273 before the helicopter arrives, they will provide security while on their property.

lz_desc: The LZ is on grass but the helicopter may also land on the asphalt lot located approximately 30 feet west of the indicated LZ.
comments: This is a City park and also used as a fair grounds.

lz_desc: The parking lot has asphalt with a few bad spot.  There are some light poles on the parking lot but no other obstacles present.
hazards: Some light poles present, no wires running above ground to them.
comments: This is an old car lot and is not currently in use.

lz_desc: The landing zone is in a large grass field, if there has been recent rain land on the packed gravel road between the LZ and building.  There are many places to land on this property.
hazards: Power lines on the north side of Highway 18 near the road (south of the LZ) and on the far west side of the lot and also close to the buildings.
comments: This is a large cotton gin located between Blytheville and Dell.  The gin is north of Highway 18 and west of Highway 312.

lz_desc: Large grass field.
comments: This is the old baseball field it is a large open field with a gymnasium located on the west side of the field.  The volunteer Fire Department is located on the far west side of the lot.

lz_desc: This is a grass LZ.

address1: Intersection of US 62 and Ozark Automotive Road
lz_desc: LZ is located in a small mowed field with trees around it. Best approach is from the NW.  Fire department provides experienced ground marshals, portable windsock near the highway, and usually a fire pumper with crew.  Fire station is due south across the intersection.
hazards: Trees
comments: LZ will generally have an experienced ground marshal, portable windsock and a fire engine with crew.

lz_name: Inspiration Point Fire LZ#2 (Sky Ranch Airfield)
lz_desc: LZ is on a 1900 foot grass runway.  Normal operation is to land to the west on the runway following instructions of the ground marshal.
hazards: While the several acre field south of the runway is inviting as an LZ there is a significant FOD danger.  Follow the ground marshal's instructions.
app_dep:
Approach:  Make eastward left traffic approach to hover taxi on the runway and follow ground marshal to parking on the runway.
Departure is pilot option.
comments: Sky Ranch Airfield is a little used 1900 foot unregistered grass air strip.  LZ will usually be controlled by experienced ground marshals using hand signals.

Approach from the north west, watch for ground marshal.
Departure: At pilots discretion.
comments: Concrete landing pad at Inspiration Point Fire Station #2

hazards: There are two unlit towers in the vicinity of Ridgecrest Regional Hospital. Tower 1 is 1/3 of a mile to the south and approximately 100 feet tall. Tower 2 is about ½ mile to the south and approximately 50 feet tall. They each have obstruction lights, but they are inoperative. The easiest way to avoid these towers is to depart Ridgecrest Hospital to the southeast and fly south over China Lake Blvd (the main north/south road on the east side of the hospital) until you are south of the Home Depot and then turn on course.
app_dep:
Try and stay over N. China Lake Blvd until needing to align for the pad. N. China Lake is the major road that runs North/South and is on the east side of the Hospital.
Plan all approaches preferably to the North, adjust as necessary for winds
Fly your pattern to the East of the Hospital for departures and or arrivals
Try to do a more normal to steep approach based on performance data.
Climb out as necessary to the appropriate altitudes as fast as safely possible

comments: Heliport operated by CalStar

hazards: Just west of extended centerline of runways near 3 mile final for 30L and R.
